metadata.Title: CVE-2010-5107 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The default configuration of OpenSSH through 6.1 enforces a fixed timelimit between establishing a TCP connection and completing a login, whichmakes it easier for remote attackers to cause a denial of service(connection-slot exhaustion) by periodically making many new TCPconnections.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-5107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:6.1p1-3
openssh-server - 1:6.1p1-3
openssh-sftp-server - 1:6.1p1-3
ssh - 1:6.1p1-3
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:6.1p1-3
ssh-krb5 - 1:6.1p1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:6.1p1-3').
